intro: Andersonia lehmanniana subsp. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy Andersonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The subspecies is distinguished by its hairy leaves and stems, which provide a unique texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
